title: Why is that banshee's is a 40 second cool down
body: and resets every time you get auto'd by an enemy but edge of the night is a flat almost basically a 25second cd? how does this make any sense? Banshess sucks compared to this item.

replies.body: Because the "drawback" of Edge of Night is the fact you have to channel it to work and that can be interrupted. Not that many people try to channel in the middle of a fight, since the smart thing is prior to an engage.
You can argue that Banshee's Veil has a 40 second channel, because any damage you take during that time will set its cooldown to 40 seconds again.
You can cast spells and auto attack during banshee's "channel"
if you consider the fact that this is a tank item, and most tanks that attack and most likely going to get hit, it doesn't really matter.

Or the fact that BV is a terrible item as a whole >.>

BV gives you 70 MR and all, but the extra MR over SV isn't worth losing CDR and Health over. Banshee's isn't even cost effective while SV boasts a whopping 25% cost efficiency on BV (121% to 96%) BEFORE the healing passive.

MR itemization in this game is absolutely terrible because the only real options most people have are Abyssal (which is honestly better than BV on AP tanks if your midlane isn't getting it tbh), Locket, SV, GA, and BV.

So like when u engage on her and she ults u and that gets block, she's literally useless. If someone like a janna tries to peel u off her adc, you would be able to block it with EoN. Ultimates are almost always shorter cd than spells like flash, exhaust and heal. EoN is hated cause of that, because you can be a NON-ADC and still get oneshotted by someone with full lethality and u actually having an item that gives u armor and the assassin still deleting u

If you are playing ashe and a zed is running at you with edge of night on do you ult or volley first? Note he cannot tank the volley then use edge because you are now in combat and if he has edge on in advance volley breaks it so you can ult him.

If it lasted 2 seconds but it took 1.5 seconds to channel, you'd effectively have only .5 seconds of usability. That's considering that you'd have to be out of the fight for 1.5 seconds in order not to get interrupted, only to have to walk to the fight and for it to expire almost immediately.

Not saying that this would 100% of the time be the case.
What i'm saying is if you're making them last as long as Sivir's  and Nocturne's shields, the EoN active CANNOT have a channel time at all. It would have to be instant. But an instant spell block is probably what Riot didn't want to introduce or they essentially make an item with an "on demand" spell shield. So Riot wasn't looking to make every Marksman into Sivir.

I'd argue that a 5 second duration would be OK to test.
And a higher CD on the active (40-45 seconds).
Possibly with some damage reductions (-5 ~ -10 dmg) as well.

0.5 seconds to make effective use of a spell shield is far too short of a time to be usable. 

Edge of Night will be getting some nerfs in the future, at the very least the CD is to be drastically increased.

What I see to be the great issue with edge of night is it takes away your ability to hard CC champs like Master Yi.  Example:  Yi pops EoN, Ults, runs at you retard style like they do and unless you have 2-3 hard CC gets a double or triple.  Plus you get AD, MR, MS, and Lethality thats a fuck load for 3100g.
